metadata.title: CVE-2012-6150 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The winbind_name_list_to_sid_string_list function in nsswitch/pam_winbind.cin Samba through 4.1.2 handles invalid require_membership_of group names byaccepting authentication by any user, which allows remote authenticatedusers to bypass intended access restrictions in opportunistic circumstancesby leveraging an administrator's pam_winbind configuration-file mistake.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6150` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbclient - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
python-samba - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
registry-tools - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-libs - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
smbclient - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
winbind - 2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.0.13+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
